function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'foo' to reach function 'main'?
loop_reachability: Can the loop with condition 'i < 10' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'i < 10' always executed?
Is it possible that the loop with condition '!stop' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition '!stop' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < 10' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition '!stop' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Does the value assigned to 'x (line 3)' affect subsequent computations?
Is variable 'x (line 5)' used after its definition?
liveness: Does variable 'pointer3' remain in use at the end of function 'foo'?
Does variable 'addend3' remain in use at the end of function 'foo'?
dead_code: Can the statement 'main (void)' be considered dead code?
Can the program actually reach the statement: “#define INIT_ARRAY(A) array##A[1] = 1.0f, array##A[5] = 2.0f”?
